Flow_Content.Description: Most elements that can appear in the body

Sectioning_Content.Description: Defines sections in a document outline

Form_Associated_Content.Description: Elements that participate in form submission

HTML_Raw_Text_Elements.Description: Content is raw text — no HTML parsing inside

HTML_Escapable_Raw_Text_Elements.Description: Content is raw, but entities are allowed

HTML_Special_Parsing_Rules: Optional closing tags (p, li, dt, dd, tr, td)
Script element blocks parsing until closed

Element_Upgrade_Flow: Browser upgrades existing matching DOM nodes

ShadowDOM_Retargeting_Rules: Events crossing shadow boundary are retargeted
Event.target becomes host if deep inside shadow root
composed: true allows passing through shadow DOM
composed: false keeps event trapped inside shadow tree
focus events do not cross shadow DOM

Avoiding_Reflow_Techniques: avoid reading layout after writing layout

HTML_HTTP_Behavior_With_Meta_And_Link: Pre-connect to domains to improve performance
DNS-prefetch to reduce DNS lookup time
Set canonical URL for SEO ranking consistency

COEP_Behavior: Requires CORP or CORP-like headers on embeds
CORP_Use_Cases: Used with COEP to allow SharedArrayBuffer
Mixed_Content_Auto_Upgrade: Images automatically upgraded to HTTPS when possible

Module_Import_Syntax: import { a, b as c } from './file.js'
Script_Nomodule_Behavior: Ignored by modern browsers that support ES modules
CORS_Preflight_Rules: Triggered by content-type not in simple list
Server must respond with matching headers
CrossOrigin_Embedding_Rules: img/video/audio allow cross-origin loading by default
link rel=stylesheet cross-origin but CSSOM blocked
iframe requires allow-same-origin for JS access
Module_Fetching_Rules: Reject if MIME type is wrong

Image_Loading_Behavior: Alt text rendered if image fails
Picture_Element_Behavior: Used for art direction and type-switching
Lazy_Loading_Rules: loading=lazy delays fetch until near viewport
Does not delay LCP image with importance=high

Form_Disabled_Rules: Disabled controls do not trigger validation

radio: only one with same name may be checked

special_notes: Can act like <a> when href provided
Stylistic offset element; no semantic meaning
A document can have only one <base>
Used for embedding text with unknown directionality
Creates a new line in text
Legacy text blinking, unsupported in modern browsers
Replaced by <object> or <iframe> in many cases
Deprecated early Web Components v0 syntax
Disabling fieldset disables all descendant controls except first legend
Represents the footer of nearest sectioning root
Commonly used for metadata, links, copyright
Represents idiomatic text, technical terms, taxonomic text
No italic requirement; styling done via CSS
File inputs cannot set value via script
Used for stylesheets, icons, preloads, DNS-prefetch
Used for: stylesheet, preload, prefetch, dns-prefetch
modulepreload participates in module graph loading
Controls charset, viewport, SEO, caching, security
Assistive tech uses this for landmarks
Acts as form control if type recognized
Inline quotation element, user agent inserts quotes
Fallback parentheses for browsers without ruby support
Represents content that is no longer accurate or relevant
Inline scripts require correct CSP nonce
slotchange event fires when assigned nodes change
Represents side comments or legal disclaimers
CSP may block inline CSS unless nonce provided
Rendered before tbody for incremental layout
